text:
In the final project,

1) First, choose your model

  • Time & Money: video link
  • Food Waste: video link
  • Once you choose your project, see more details in the respective tabs.

2) Analyze the model and list the concerns

3) Document your process

4) Create a drawing

5) Build your model

6) Test your model

7) Compare your model with the initial model

8) Generalize

You can only edit tiles that are within your workspace to the right. If you lose a question tile, you can get a fresh copy of it below.

  • Click on the dots in the top right corner of the desired question tile below and drag it into your own workspace.
  • Answer each question in your workspace by typing in the tile with the question in it.

1. Which project will you improve? Bold the project that you will work on.

  • Time & Money
  • Food Waste

2. What concerns do you have about the initial model? Describe at least two below.

Which concern(s) will you try to fix in your revision? Bold it in your list above.

3. Document your improvement process.

What assumptions AND variables are you using in your revised model?

tiles.title: 4. Create a Drawing to Communicate Your Model

text: 5. Build your model in the diagram tile in your Workspace.
6. Test your model in the diagram tile above and record the results in the next three tiles.

Test 1

1. How are you testing your model?

2. What are your test results?

3. What do these results mean in the problem context?

Test 2

1. How are you testing your model?

2. What are your test results?

3. What do these results mean in the problem context?

Test 3

1. How are you testing your model?

2. What are your test results?

3. What do these results mean in the problem context?
7. Explain how your model compares with the initial model.
8. Explain how your model can be used to solve similar problems. Describe an example.

9. Write a report about your model by writing a letter to your client:

  • Stating how you have improved the initial model
  • Stating the strengths and weaknesses of your revised model
  • Advising your client and anyone on how to use the revised model

Dear Client,

Sincerely,

(Name of group members)
